b3db50a6-402a-4214-82e7-6af062bd990f.description: Earners of the Legislative Office Leadership micro-credential have practiced the skills needed to lead high-functioning legislative offices: team management, negotiation, conflict management, and strategic communications. Through their participation in the ISLG Kriegel Fellowship for Public Service Leaders, a professional development program for chiefs of staff to city and state legislators, earners have engaged in a series of evidence-based and expert-led trainings on these topics.

badge_template_activities.title: Participates in either or both of the following activities: one coaching session with ISLG leadership, during which earners identify two management challenges in their offices and action items to overcome those challenges; one peer-to-peer coaching session, during which earners identify one management challenge in their offices and action items to overcome their challenge.
Prepares for and participates in at least one negotiation simulation, guided by a negotiation expert, and utilizes best practices for negotiation.
Creates an editorial calendar for their legislative office, utilizing best practices for press engagement and strategic communications.

Participates in the ISLG Kriegel Fellowship for Public Service Leaders, a professional development program designed specifically for chiefs of staff to city and state legislatures offices. Attends five of the seven fellowship sessions on leadership and management.

a803c5e1-8fd6-4e2b-85ba-53d632c603e8.description: Earners of the Community Engagement in Legislative Offices micro-credential can implement best practices for reaching and engaging constituents as leaders in legislative offices: safe and regular two-way communication, goal-oriented collaboration, and inclusive, transparent decision-making. Earners learn these practices through their participation in the ISLG Kriegel Fellowship for Public Service Leaders, a professional development program for chiefs of staff to city and state legislators.

Participates in the ISLG Kriegel Fellowship for Public Service Leaders, a professional development program designed specifically for chiefs of staff to city and state legislatures offices. Attends two fellowship sessions on community engagement.

72a7e283-f074-452f-a40a-4c33cce025ab.description: This micro-credential marks earners’ successful completion of the ISLG Kriegel Fellowship for Public Service Leaders, a professional development program for chiefs of staff to city and state legislators. To earn this micro-credential, earners had to receive a series of three micro-credentials, demonstrating knowledge and achievement in areas specific to their roles as chiefs of staff: Legislative Office Leadership, Public Policy in New York City, and Community Engagement in Legislative Offices.
